# Multisig security for your onchain assets

The most trusted smart wallet infrastructure. Modular, programmable and battle-tested.

Launch App![chevron-right](https://safe.global/images/common/chevron-right.svg)

![Hero Image](https://safe.global/images/homepage/mock-mobile.jpg)![Hero Image](https://safe.global/images/homepage/mock-desktop.png)

![Hero Image](https://safe.global/images/homepage/mock-mobile.jpg)

Used by the best

Safe{Wallet} powers onchain treasuries for leading organizations

![aave logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/aave.png)

![eigen-layer logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/eigen-layer.png)

![ethereum-foundation logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/ethereum-foundation.png)

![morpho logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/morpho.png)

![balancer logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/balancer.png)

![vaneck logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/vaneck.png)

## Your treasury, full control

Build and simulate transaction flows. Manage payments, interact with DeFi and govern protocols all in one place

### Multisig Wallet

Eliminate single point of failure. Distribute access control across multiple owners

![Multisig Wallet](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/multi-sig.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow-full.png)

### Scan and Simulate transactions

Scan risks and simulate transactions before they execute

![Scan and Simulate transactions](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/simulate-transactions.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow.png)

### Spending Limits & Roles

Set daily spending limits, approval thresholds and role-based access

![Spending Limits & Roles](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/spending-roles.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow.png)

### Multichain Treasury

Invite team members to manage and track multi-chain Safe accounts together

![Multichain Treasury](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/multichain-treasury.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow.png)

### Transaction Builder

Cut gas costs by bundling complex transactions into one signing step

![Transaction Builder](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/transaction-builder.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow.png)

![lock](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/lock-image.png)

## Business ready security

Defend against threats and operate treasuries with increased monitoring and security features

![plus](https://safe.global/images/common/plus-green.svg)

![No single point of failure](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/no-single-failure.svg)

No single point of failure

Defend against private key compromises and setup thresholds

![Formally verified contracts](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/verified-formally.svg)

Formally verified contracts

Safe is among the most audited and battle-tested contracts on Ethereum.

![Open source](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/open-source.svg)

Open source

No black box for your treasury. Independently verify all changes

![Trustless recovery](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/trustless-recovery.svg)

Trustless recovery

Never loose access to your account by nominating a guardian

Audited by the best in the space

![ackee](https://safe.global/images/common/auditors/ackee.png)![runtime](https://safe.global/images/common/auditors/runtime.png)![open-zeppelin](https://safe.global/images/common/auditors/open-zeppelin.png)![certora](https://safe.global/images/common/auditors/certora.png)

## Not all custody wallets are created equal

Pricing

Security

Transparency

Flexibility

Risk Control

Vendor Lock-In

![Safe](https://safe.global/images/common/safe-logo.svg)

0 AUM fees

Onchain, transparent N-of-M signing

Fully onchain & open source

Modular, programmable, composable

User-owned, replaceable signers

Fully portable accounts

MPCs

Subscription + usage costs

Offchain MPC signing

Limited

Policy engine

Vendor-dependent

Full Vendor Lock-in

Hardware Wallets

One-time device cost

Offline key storage; single-signer risk

Limited

Limited automation

Lost device = lost access

Fully portable accounts

Safe, like Morpho, makes security its top priority. That's why we see strong alignment and confidence using Safe for Morpho's daily operations across multiple networks, making it a key building block of our operational stack.

![User](https://safe.global/images/homepage/avatar1.png)

Merlin Egalite, Co-Founder Morpho Labs

$1T+

Total value processed

57M+

Wallets deployed

$60B+

Total value secured

![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/glow.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/glow-mobile.png)

## Trusted by onchain organizations and power users

From DAOs, power users,teams, protocol and treasury operator, everyone is using Safe{Wallet}

For Organizations

Treasury security, multisig, policy management, SafeApps

[Learn More![chevron-right](https://safe.global/images/common/chevron-right-green.svg)](https://safe.global/teams)

![Organization background](https://safe.global/images/homepage/organisations.png)

For Power Users

Scan risks, access DeFi and recover accounts

[Learn More![chevron-right](https://safe.global/images/common/chevron-right-green.svg)](https://safe.global/users)

![Organization background](https://safe.global/images/homepage/power-user.png)

## What users say about us

![Worldcoin logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/World_Logo.svg)

World Foundation relies on Safe Wallet to securely manage critical operations and transactions. Safe Wallet's flexibility allows additional protections for users, optimization of transaction fees and entirely new mechanisms like priority blockspace for humans.

Remco Bloemen

Head of Blockchain, Worldcoin

![Remco Bloemen](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/worldavatar.png)

![EF logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/EF.png)

Safe is an important part of the Ethereum ecosystem. The EF is an active Safe{Wallet} user, as it aligns with our "DeFiPunk" ethos and open-source, local-first, permissionless, and non-custodial ideals.

Hsiao-Wei Wang

Co-Executive Director, Ethereum Foundation

![Hsiao-Wei Wang](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/EFAvatar.png)

![ENS logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/ENSlogo.png)

Safe makes managing crypto assets secure, reliable, and easy. Whether you're working solo or with a team, the multisig setup and intuitive interface give us full control and peace of mind. It's the gold standard for smart contract wallets.

![Morpho logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/morpho.png)

Safe, like Morpho, makes security its top priority. That‚Äôs why we see strong alignment and confidence using Safe for Morpho‚Äôs daily operations across multiple networks, making it a key building block of our operational stack.

Merlin Egalite

Co-Founder, Morpho Labs

![Merlin Egalite](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/morphoavatar.png)

I use a multisig (safe) for >90% of my personal funds.
M-of-N, some keys held by you (but not enough to block recovery), the rest held by other people you trust. Don't reveal who those other people are, even to each other.

Vitalik Buterin

Co founder, Ethereum

![Vitalik Buterin](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/vitalik.png)

![Polygon logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/polygon-matic-logo.png)

100% true Safe is the backbone of the crypto industry. They should be celebrated more.

Sandeep Nailwal

Co founder, Polygon

![Sandeep Nailwal](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/Polygonavatar.png)

![Optimism logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/optimism.svg)

We‚Äôve been using Safe for everything from protocol upgrades to treasury management for over four years. Their multisig setup, combined with guards and modules, gives us the right balance of security and flexibility.

![Chainlink Labs logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/Chainlinklogo.svg)

We‚Äôre excited about how our strategic alliance with Safe is advancing the secure, user friendly account abstraction that‚Äôs needed for the mass adoption of Web3. Safe‚Äôs modular infrastructure, combined with the industry-standard Chainlink oracle platform, has created a strong foundation for making blockchain applications more accessible and resilient. It‚Äôs been great to see our work together mature into real adoption that drives our industry forward

Thodoris Karakostas

Head of Blockchain Partnerships, Chainlink Labs

![Thodoris Karakostas](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/chainlinkavatar.png)

i need to count how many safe wallets we have (its a lot)

Punk6529

Founder, 6529.io

![Punk6529](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/PunkAvatar.png)

## From Tools to Treasuries, It's All Safe

Swap, Stake, Earn, Govern and more. Interact with 200+ apps integrated with Safe{Wallet}.

![op](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/op.png)

![image9](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/image9.png)

![image6](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/image6.png)

![close](https://safe.global/images/common/close.svg)

Safe Wallet is now operated by Safe Labs

Check out the announcement.

**$1 Trillion+** in volume processed

# Multisig security for your onchain assets

The most trusted smart wallet infrastructure. Modular, programmable and battle-tested.

Launch App![chevron-right](https://safe.global/images/common/chevron-right.svg)

![Hero Image](https://safe.global/images/homepage/mock-mobile.jpg)![Hero Image](https://safe.global/images/homepage/mock-desktop.png)

![Hero Image](https://safe.global/images/homepage/mock-mobile.jpg)

Used by the best

Safe{Wallet} powers onchain treasuries for leading organizations

![aave logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/aave.png)

![eigen-layer logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/eigen-layer.png)

![ethereum-foundation logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/ethereum-foundation.png)

![morpho logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/morpho.png)

![balancer logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/balancer.png)

![vaneck logo](https://safe.global/images/common/companies/vaneck.png)

## Your treasury, full control

Build and simulate transaction flows. Manage payments, interact with DeFi and govern protocols all in one place

### Multisig Wallet

Eliminate single point of failure. Distribute access control across multiple owners

![Multisig Wallet](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/multi-sig.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow-full.png)

### Scan and Simulate transactions

Scan risks and simulate transactions before they execute

![Scan and Simulate transactions](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/simulate-transactions.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow.png)

### Spending Limits & Roles

Set daily spending limits, approval thresholds and role-based access

![Spending Limits & Roles](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/spending-roles.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow.png)

### Multichain Treasury

Invite team members to manage and track multi-chain Safe accounts together

![Multichain Treasury](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/multichain-treasury.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow.png)

### Transaction Builder

Cut gas costs by bundling complex transactions into one signing step

![Transaction Builder](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/transaction-builder.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/control-center/glow.png)

![lock](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/lock-image.png)

## Business ready security

Defend against threats and operate treasuries with increased monitoring and security features

![plus](https://safe.global/images/common/plus-green.svg)

![No single point of failure](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/no-single-failure.svg)

No single point of failure

Defend against private key compromises and setup thresholds

![Formally verified contracts](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/verified-formally.svg)

Formally verified contracts

Safe is among the most audited and battle-tested contracts on Ethereum.

![Open source](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/open-source.svg)

Open source

No black box for your treasury. Independently verify all changes

![Trustless recovery](https://safe.global/images/homepage/security/trustless-recovery.svg)

Trustless recovery

Never loose access to your account by nominating a guardian

Audited by the best in the space

![ackee](https://safe.global/images/common/auditors/ackee.png)![runtime](https://safe.global/images/common/auditors/runtime.png)![open-zeppelin](https://safe.global/images/common/auditors/open-zeppelin.png)![certora](https://safe.global/images/common/auditors/certora.png)

## Not all custody wallets are created equal

Pricing

Security

Transparency

Flexibility

Risk Control

Vendor Lock-In

![Safe](https://safe.global/images/common/safe-logo.svg)

0 AUM fees

Onchain, transparent N-of-M signing

Fully onchain & open source

Modular, programmable, composable

User-owned, replaceable signers

Fully portable accounts

MPCs

Subscription + usage costs

Offchain MPC signing

Limited

Policy engine

Vendor-dependent

Full Vendor Lock-in

Hardware Wallets

One-time device cost

Offline key storage; single-signer risk

Limited

Limited automation

Lost device = lost access

Fully portable accounts

Safe, like Morpho, makes security its top priority. That's why we see strong alignment and confidence using Safe for Morpho's daily operations across multiple networks, making it a key building block of our operational stack.

![User](https://safe.global/images/homepage/avatar1.png)

Merlin Egalite, Co-Founder Morpho Labs

$1T+

Total value processed

57M+

Wallets deployed

$60B+

Total value secured

![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/glow.png)![Glow](https://safe.global/images/homepage/glow-mobile.png)

## Trusted by onchain organizations and power users

From DAOs, power users,teams, protocol and treasury operator, everyone is using Safe{Wallet}

For Organizations

Treasury security, multisig, policy management, SafeApps

[Learn More![chevron-right](https://safe.global/images/common/chevron-right-green.svg)](https://safe.global/teams)

![Organization background](https://safe.global/images/homepage/organisations.png)

For Power Users

Scan risks, access DeFi and recover accounts

[Learn More![chevron-right](https://safe.global/images/common/chevron-right-green.svg)](https://safe.global/users)

![Organization background](https://safe.global/images/homepage/power-user.png)

## What users say about us

![Worldcoin logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/World_Logo.svg)

World Foundation relies on Safe Wallet to securely manage critical operations and transactions. Safe Wallet's flexibility allows additional protections for users, optimization of transaction fees and entirely new mechanisms like priority blockspace for humans.

Remco Bloemen

Head of Blockchain, Worldcoin

![Remco Bloemen](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/worldavatar.png)

![EF logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/EF.png)

Safe is an important part of the Ethereum ecosystem. The EF is an active Safe{Wallet} user, as it aligns with our "DeFiPunk" ethos and open-source, local-first, permissionless, and non-custodial ideals.

Hsiao-Wei Wang

Co-Executive Director, Ethereum Foundation

![Hsiao-Wei Wang](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/EFAvatar.png)

![ENS logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/ENSlogo.png)

Safe makes managing crypto assets secure, reliable, and easy. Whether you're working solo or with a team, the multisig setup and intuitive interface give us full control and peace of mind. It's the gold standard for smart contract wallets.

![Morpho logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/morpho.png)

Safe, like Morpho, makes security its top priority. That‚Äôs why we see strong alignment and confidence using Safe for Morpho‚Äôs daily operations across multiple networks, making it a key building block of our operational stack.

Merlin Egalite

Co-Founder, Morpho Labs

![Merlin Egalite](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/morphoavatar.png)

I use a multisig (safe) for >90% of my personal funds.
M-of-N, some keys held by you (but not enough to block recovery), the rest held by other people you trust. Don't reveal who those other people are, even to each other.

Vitalik Buterin

Co founder, Ethereum

![Vitalik Buterin](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/vitalik.png)

![Polygon logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/polygon-matic-logo.png)

100% true Safe is the backbone of the crypto industry. They should be celebrated more.

Sandeep Nailwal

Co founder, Polygon

![Sandeep Nailwal](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/Polygonavatar.png)

![Optimism logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/optimism.svg)

We‚Äôve been using Safe for everything from protocol upgrades to treasury management for over four years. Their multisig setup, combined with guards and modules, gives us the right balance of security and flexibility.

![Chainlink Labs logo](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/Chainlinklogo.svg)

We‚Äôre excited about how our strategic alliance with Safe is advancing the secure, user friendly account abstraction that‚Äôs needed for the mass adoption of Web3. Safe‚Äôs modular infrastructure, combined with the industry-standard Chainlink oracle platform, has created a strong foundation for making blockchain applications more accessible and resilient. It‚Äôs been great to see our work together mature into real adoption that drives our industry forward

Thodoris Karakostas

Head of Blockchain Partnerships, Chainlink Labs

![Thodoris Karakostas](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/chainlinkavatar.png)

i need to count how many safe wallets we have (its a lot)

Punk6529

Founder, 6529.io

![Punk6529](https://safe.global/images/common/reviews/PunkAvatar.png)

## From Tools to Treasuries, It's All Safe

Swap, Stake, Earn, Govern and more. Interact with 200+ apps integrated with Safe{Wallet}.

![image16](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/image16.png)

![image5](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/image5.png)

![image18](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/image18.png)

![image10](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/image10.png)

![op](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/op.png)

![image5](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/image5.png)

![op](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/op.png)

![image9](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/image9.png)

![image6](https://safe.global/images/homepage/apps-integration/image6.png)

Build on Safe

Discover Apps

## Track and sign transactions on mobile

Get notifications and sign transactions on the move.

![apple](https://safe.global/images/common/apple-icon.svg)Download on iOS![playstore](https://safe.global/images/common/playstore-icon.svg)Download on Android

![mobile apps](https://safe.global/images/homepage/mobile-apps/apps.png)

Join thousands of teams managing assets securely

Secure and easy self-custody for everyone

Read Docs

April 21st, 2022

_**Today marks the launch of the Zodiac Exit App. This companion app completes the Zodiac Exit pattern, which allows DAO members to redeem a designated token for a proportion of a Safe‚Äôs treasury. To incorporate this pattern in your DAO, [equip the mod](https://zodiac.wiki/index.php/Category:Exit_Pattern) through the Zodiac App available on Gnosis Safe, and then members can visit [exit.gnosisguild.org](https://exit.gnosisguild.org/) when they choose to exit.**_

_**To learn more about and participate in the Zodiac ecosystem, follow [@gnosisguild](https://www.twitter.com/gnosisguild) and join the [Gnosis Guild Discord](https://discord.gg/gnosisguild).**_

DAOs often prioritize their entrances, but what about their exits?

In late 2021, [ConstitutionDAO](https://www.constitutiondao.com/) memed itself into history when it bid on a copy of the U.S. Constitution. The speedrun DAO broke the record for the largest crowdfund for a physical object in a 72-hour period, onboarding thousands into crypto and raising nearly $43 million from 17.5K contributors. But after its failed bid, the lack of clarity over the refund process resulted in [confusion](https://twitter.com/ConstitutionDAO/status/1462588701410615300). Its exit plan, as it turns out, was not nearly as clear as its entrance.

To create new patterns around onboarding and offboarding, Gnosis Guild debuted the [Zodiac Exit Module](https://gnosis.github.io/zodiac/docs/tutorial-module-exit/get-started/), a modular exit mechanism similar to MolochDAO's rageQuit() functionality. Had ConstitutionDAO equipped its multisig Safe with the Exit Module, supporters could have redeemed their $PEOPLE tokens for a proportion of the Safe treasury‚Äôs digital assets, instantly and permissionlessly.

The good news is that exit patterns are already experiencing swift cultural development. Not even three months later, [AssangeDAO](https://assangedao.org/) [announced](https://assangedao.substack.com/p/updates-on-juicebox-funding-and-justice?utm_source=url) that it would equip the Exit Module to its Safe if its [historic bid](https://twitter.com/wikileaks/status/1491413075341512707) had not won, signaling perhaps the beginning of a new model.

## New Exit Patterns

Today, we continue to nurture new exit patterns with our latest contribution to the Zodiac open standard: the **[Exit App](https://exit.gnosisguild.org/)**. While the Exit Module allowed DAO operators to enable an exit mechanism, the Exit App provides DAO members a friendly interface to even more easily exit. This companion app now completes the Zodiac Exit pattern by offering interfaces for all of its functionalities.

**Most significantly, the Zodiac Exit pattern now also supports NFT exits**. This means that, for the first time, members can redeem an NFT for their proportion of a Safe's treasury, a feature that would greatly benefit those currently unable to exit organizations whose membership is based on holding an NFT. One could imagine this in the case of storied NFT projects like [Loot](https://www.lootproject.com/): the exit from one quest to spark the start of another.

![NFT Exit](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/jvck1Eu8ZGyAJVPqhSuyt.png)

NFT Exit

### A brief summary of what the Exit App enables:

‚óç **EASY EXITS:** While redeeming tokens was always possible on a contract level for Safes equipped with the Exit Module, the Exit App provides members a nice user interface to initiate the transaction. Exiting members can now simply log into the standalone Exit App at [exit.gnosisguild.org](https://exit.gnosisguild.org/) and leave a DAO with their proportion of tokens.

‚óç **NFT EXITS:** Members can now use NFTs to exit from organizations that use non-fungible tokens for membership. In this case, a Safe's assets are divided equally per NFT among an entire NFT collection. For example, if the circulating supply of an NFT collection is 2, the account redeeming one NFT will receive 50% of the Safe's assets.

‚óç **SAFE EXITS:** Members who hold a DAO's designated token in their own Safe can now easily exit too. In order to redeem, the member simply opens the Exit App as a Safe App, inputs the DAO's Safe address, and then selects the token(s) they want to claim.

‚óç **EXPERIMENTAL "EXITS":** The Exit Module, as a reminder, also has custom settings that can introduce new forms of DAO co-ownership and [holding in common](https://gnosisguild.mirror.xyz/l3pGN7TOUgPkzeurDlllIaAocaVqQuZkN98-BLAhKRc), including decentralized token swaps and other DAO-to-DAO innovations. ‚ú® Experimentation is welcome. ‚ú®

## How to Use the Exit App

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lFtChXUQ7SkWliZ-ns-VM.png)

1. **Navigate to the Exit App**

‚Ä¢ If you are a member exiting with a web3 wallet, visit the standalone version of the Exit App here: [exit.gnosisguild.org](https://exit.gnosisguild.org/).

‚Ä¢ If you are a member exiting a Safe while using a Safe account to store your redeemable assets, find the Exit App through the Safe Apps list in your Gnosis Safe.

2. **Attach Safe and wallet**

To attach an Exit-enabled Safe, select the correct network at the top dropdown menu and enter the Safe's address into the `Account Address` field. (Note: The Exit App can only be used with Safes equipped with the Exit Module.) Next, attach your web3 wallet (e.g. MetaMask) by clicking on "Connect Wallet" in the left panel.

3. **Designate token**

‚Ä¢ If exiting with an ERC-20 token, enter the amount that you would like to claim in the `Exit Amount` field in the left panel and click on the appropriate checkbox(es) under "Select assets to claim" in the right panel.

‚Ä¢ If exiting the DAO by redeeming an NFT (ERC-721), you must select the intended NFT to redeem by using the dropdown menu under "Exit Token" in the left panel and click on the appropriate checkbox(es) under "Select assets to claim" in the right panel.

4. **Verify transaction details**

Verify that the transaction details are correct, including the `Exit Token` and `Amount`, the claimable asset(s), and the `Claimable Value`.

5. **Initiate & execute transaction**

Click "Exit and Claim Assets" and then approve & execute the transaction with your web3 wallet. Once the transaction is completed, the transaction button in the Exit App will now say "Exit Successful!" The Exit App will update the values of both your balance and the attached Safe account's treasury.


_For detailed step-by-step instructions, visit the [Zodiac documentation](https://zodiac.wiki/index.php/Category:Exit_Pattern)._

## Exit as Emergence

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HnnBic8v12CX3jBLqXVXh.png)

Exiting a DAO remains a critical operating principle for decentralized organizations. As DAOs continue to experiment with new membership arrangements and engagement levels, their exit mechanisms should become as simple and as transparent as their entrance. The Exit App is another vital step on this pathway.

_**The Zodiac Exit App completes the Zodiac Exit pattern, which allows DAO members to redeem a designated token for a proportion of a Safe‚Äôs treasury. To incorporate this pattern in your DAO, [equip the mod](https://zodiac.wiki/index.php/Category:Exit_Pattern) through the Zodiac App available on Gnosis Safe, and then members can visit [exit.gnosisguild.org](https://exit.gnosisguild.org/) when they choose to exit.**_

_**To learn more about and participate in the Zodiac ecosystem, follow [@gnosisguild](https://www.twitter.com/gnosisguild) and join the [Gnosis Guild Discord](https://discord.gg/gnosisguild).**_

_**Security:**_ _The Zodiac Exit Mod and App audit has been performed by the G0 group. The audit results are available as a PDF in this [repo](https://github.com/gnosis/zodiac-module-exit/blob/master/packages/contracts/audits/ZodiacExitModuleJan2022.pdf)._

kei üóùÔ∏è (Inactive)

December 28th, 2021

## A short reflection to end the year

**‚Äã‚Äã** How you spend the time in your life is precious. The question of how we should be living differently is a gift.

Reflecting on the work of the past year, it‚Äôs clear that attention is building. As a [recent tweet said](https://twitter.com/vgr/status/1473146566768693256), ‚ÄúThe first rule of Web3 fight club is you must always talk about Web3 fight club‚Äù. The signal-to-noise ratio may be lower than ever, but at the same time, acronyms like DAOs begin to take on public meaning. The question of how we should be working differently repeats.

Choosing to spend my time working on DAOs, I have to continually revisit, reevaluate, and reinvigorate my aims. There are the short-term measurable indicators of success: total value managed by our tools. There are also mid-term navigation points: what will organizational forms look like in three decades from now, and what coordinated feats will they support? I embrace one theory of change that cultural norms, even more so than technical capabilities, influence our sphere of action. That is, while technical capabilities play a role in determining the possible, cultural norms curtail it more than we usually think.

Though these technical capabilities do not usually ship with a sealed fate, they have cultural _potential_, a wide range of propensities from which some can be encouraged more than others. On this subtly charted course, more decisions do not always equal better decisions. Greater coordination can be to ill ends. The values we can encourage steer us toward rough consensus and running _worlds_. These worlds are not built on compliance but something more wild. What is wild can also be what is common.

Reflecting on the tools of the last year, web3 makes apparent the financialization that already influences our lives. The difference may be that we‚Äôre more aware of participating in it, for better and worse. Calls to fractionalize everything are a cultural potential of the technical capabilities that will over the next five years deeply reorient how we construe value. With this cultural potential, it may be important to remember: _holding in common_ does not mean dividing what is in practice valuable.

Fractionalization of artworks, for instance, does not inherently transgress the practice of holding in common, provided owners participate in shared events. However, the cultural norm of fractionalization may have runoff effects out of step with valuable experience, leading to equating granular ownership rights with ever more granular resources due to seemingly limitless address space. We do have an opportunity to reorient epistemological mappings through cryptonetworks. We only have to quickly turn to Elinor Ostrom‚Äôs [design principles of common pool resource management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elinor_Ostrom#Design_principles_for_Common_Pool_Resource_(CPR)_institution) to find alternative inspiration. These principles emphasize methods for clear definitions, dispute resolution, and collective self-determination. A key quality: in this mapping, access is collective, and responsibility is granular yet shared.

In most forms of law, the right to be a ‚Äúlegal person‚Äù also confers responsibility, such as the duty to represent oneself legally. A land rights action brought forward by the Onondaga Nation takes this one step further:

> On March 11, 2005, the Onondaga Nation filed a complaint in a federal court in Syracuse seeking title to their lost homelands. \[...\] The lawsuit is not a land ‚Äúclaim,‚Äù because to the Onondaga land has far greater significance than the notion of property. Sid Hill, the Tadodaho, or spiritual leader, of the Haudenosaunee Confederacy, has said that the Onondaga Nation will never seek to evict people from their homes. The Onondaga people know the pain of displacement too well to inflict it on their neighbors. Instead the suit is termed a ‚Äúland rights action.‚Äù When they finally got their day in court last October, members of the Onondaga Nation argued that the land title they‚Äôre seeking is not for possession, not to exclude, but for the right to participate in the well-being of the land. Against the backdrop of Euro-American thinking, which treats land as a bundle of property rights, the Onondaga are asking for freedom to exercise their responsibility to the land. \[ [1](https://orionmagazine.org/article/the-rights-of-the-land/)\]

We can see in the Onondaga Nation‚Äôs land rights action how the idea of ownership becomes more variegated: a form of _holding in common_. As a collection of rights, ownership inextricably relates the concept of rights and responsibility. This widespread lack of disambiguation on the idea of ownership may be why the notion of art that remains publicly accessible but privately owned confounds so many. It also may be why the vision of the ‚Äúownership economy‚Äù requires further articulation.

Reflecting on long-term navigation points, I imagine scenarios based on the socio-technical infrastructure that will still exist in the next 200 years or even 2000 years. At the end of each imagination, I conclude that what may have the most impact on the future isn't decentralized digital technology alone but the governance patterns it culturally normalizes. Because even if the specific technical capabilities don't survive, but the broader network does, the cultural norms could remain too. In an essay from earlier this year, [A Prehistory of DAOs](https://gnosisguild.mirror.xyz/t4F5rItMw4-mlpLZf5JQhElbDfQ2JRVKAzEpanyxW1Q), I tried to retrace the lineage of DAOs from dangerous roots to more convivial forms. In part, I intended to help a governance pattern seeded by others\[ [2](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3356774)\]\[ [3](https://thereboot.com/beyond-cryptoeconomics-platform-cooperativism-and-the-future-of-blockchain-governance/)\]\[ [4](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3979223)\] flourish more widely: DAOs should be in closer dialogue with cooperative models. As with all encouraged governance patterns, the chance persists that it could remain more superficially embraced, and cooperative models do not ultimately inform a greater number of DAOs on a [deeper operational level](https://resources.uwcc.wisc.edu/Business%20Conversion/Becoming%20Employee%20Owned%20Toolkit.pdf). As others have glibly noted, the impetus to place cooperatives on top of global capitalism looks paltry at best. These truths neglect an opportunity that needs to be reinforced, however, which new terms like DAOs create: spawning tremendous energy that could go toward stellar megaprojects and [cultivating community in empty lots](https://www.ustreetcommunity.org/temperance-alley). Structural change often proceeds at the pace of simple memes and right timing, provided there are tools available to sustain it.

![James Webb Space Telescope (2021)](https://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/thumbnails/image/webb_spacecraft_sep_12.25.png)

James Webb Space Telescope (2021)

Choosing to spend my time working on DAOs, my theory of change operates at a very slow pace, despite the fast tempo of ‚Äúthe space‚Äù. I do believe that governance patterns must begin relationally in the responsibilities we have to each other. These responsibilities are not burdens but something more wild. Power is necessary, and the tools are secondary. We have shared memories of history, however, precisely because of our relationships with tools we built to preserve those memories. Tools are important reinforcements, bound in a feedback loop with history. In trying to be a good ancestor, we can choose what governance patterns, along with their rights, responsibilities, and remembrances, to reinforce for those who come after us.

_Thanks to Marvin Lin, Andy Tudhope, and the Other Internet Peer Review for sharing feedback on this reflection._

_Cover Image: Max Ernst, Summer Night in Arizona (1944)_

_This essay is by [@keikreutler](https://twitter.com/keikreutler?lang=de). Join the conversation in the [Gnosis Guild Discord](https://discord.gg/wwmBWTgyEq)._

### Resources

\[1\]: ‚ÄúThe Rights of the Land‚Äù, Robin Kimmerer, 2008: [https://orionmagazine.org/article/the-rights-of-the-land/](https://orionmagazine.org/article/the-rights-of-the-land/)

\[2\]: ‚ÄúFostering Worker Cooperatives with Blockchain Technology: Lessons from the Colony Project‚Äù, Morshed Mannan, 2018: [https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract\_id=3356774](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3356774)

\[3\]: ‚ÄúBeyond Cryptoeconomics: Platform Cooperativism and the Future of Blockchain Governance‚Äù, Nathan Schneider, 2021: [https://thereboot.com/beyond-cryptoeconomics-platform-cooperativism-and-the-future-of-blockchain-governance/](https://thereboot.com/beyond-cryptoeconomics-platform-cooperativism-and-the-future-of-blockchain-governance/)

\[4\]: ‚ÄúGrounding Decentralised Technologies in Cooperative Principles: What Can 'decentralised Autonomous Organisations' (DAOs) and Platform Cooperatives Learn from Each Other?‚Äù, Kelsie Nabben, Novita Puspasari, Megan Kelleher, Sadhana Sanjay, 2021: [https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract\_id=3979223](https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3979223)
